speaker: TEACHER
line: All right everyone, we've run out of time.

speaker: TEACHER
line: That's right. We're finished. You'll have more time next week.

speaker: MALE STUDENT
line: Hey, man!

speaker: MOSTOW
line: Excuse me. OUTSIDE ALLEY

speaker: MOSTOW'S APARTMENT 6
line: 30 AM

speaker: FBI AGENT
line: FBI!!

speaker: FBI AGENT
line: Don't move!

speaker: FBI AGENT
line: John Mostow... We have a warrant for your arrest. You have the right to remain silent. If you give up that right...

speaker: FBI AGENT
line: Anything you say can be used against you in a court of law.

speaker: FBI AGENT
line: Do you understand these rights as they've been explained to you?

speaker: FBI AGENT
line: Do you wish to give up your right to remain silent?

speaker: NEMHAUSER
line: OH GOD! He bit me! The son of a bitch bit me like a dog!

speaker: FBI AGENT
line: Nemhauser, you okay?

speaker: NEMHAUSER
line: Yeah.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: My God...

speaker: MULDER
line: He's an unemployed painter, divorced, no children. He came to the US from Uzbekistan during Perestroika. He failed to mention on his INS application that he spent the better part of his twenties in an insane asylum.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He was arrested last week for the murders of at least seven men.

speaker: MULDER
line: You thought all they produced were great hockey players. The crimes took place over a three year period. All the victims were male. Aged 17 to 25.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Was there a signature or a defining MO?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, according to the ME there was no evidence of any sexual assault. Death was caused by massive blood loss due to facial mutilation. We also reported that the wound pattern on all the victims was identical. It's all there on page three.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Both eyes punctured... signature gashes from the corners of the mouth to the ears.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The level of violence and overkill here would suggest the work of a very angry individual.

speaker: MULDER
line: Or individuals, if you count the spirit Mostow says possessed him during the murders.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, possession is a common claim by criminals who have dissociative disorders. It's how they... distance themselves from their actions.

speaker: MULDER
line: That was the operational opinion until last night...

speaker: MULDER
line: When a 19 year old male was found dead six miles from here with an identical set of facial wounds.

speaker: SCULLY
line: A copy cat?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, according to Assistant Director Skinner, who asked us to look into this case, the details of the mutilations were never released. Only members of the crime team would have that information. And Mostow's been in custody for five days.

speaker: MOSTOW
line: Please! The light hurts my eyes.

speaker: MOSTOW
line: Leave me alone...

speaker: SCULLY
line: You have a nice soft bunk, sir. Why aren't you using it?

speaker: MULDER
line: Cuz he's been working.

speaker: MULDER
line: Haven't you, John? What is it? What is this thing?

speaker: MOSTOW
line: It killed those men.

speaker: MULDER
line: Does it have a name? Does it have a name to go with that face?

speaker: MOSTOW
line: All men know its name.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you call it? Satan? The devil?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Or maybe it's just the name of your accomplice.

speaker: MOSTOW
line: I had no accomplice.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You killed all those young men yourself?

speaker: MOSTOW
line: It killed them. How many times do I have to tell you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, its fingerprints weren't on the murder weapon, yours were. And it won't be tried for seven murders under the death penalty.

speaker: MOSTOW
line: That is why it laughs at fools like you... And you... fools who would pretend evil can be brought to heel like a brindle bitch or be held by your pathetic gulags. While with a snap of its finger, it makes men lick the greasy floor of hell... Just to see its reflection.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is that was it did last night, John? Snapped its fingers and let another young man die?

speaker: MOSTOW
line: It killed again? Yesterday? It found somebody... just like it found me.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: Agent Mulder... Can I see you two outside? HALLWAY

speaker: PATTERSON
line: So what is it, Mulder? Little green men, evil spirits, hounds of hell?

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, this is Bill Patterson. He runs the investigative support unit out of Quantico.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, I know. Behavioral Science... You wrote the book. It's a honor, sir.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: Is that what you think, too? That the suspect is possessed by some dark spirit?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, not at all, sir.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: Funny company you keep then.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's what always amazed me about you, Bill. You never fit your own profile. No one would ever guess how really mean-spirited you are.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: The arrest of John Mostow...

speaker: PATTERSON
line: Resulted in three years of hard work by my unit. Three years... You can imagine we were awful upset by this latest murder. And by the suspect floating this possession theory.

speaker: MULDER
line: You think he's got an accomplice then. Even though your own profile of Mostow states that he's most certainly working alone.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: My profile led to his arrest. No, he acted alone. And that murder last night was done by a second killer, and he acted alone too.

speaker: MULDER
line: What about these drawings of Mostow's? The gargoyles?

speaker: PATTERSON
line: You know why he draws those? Did you ask him?

speaker: MULDER
line: I didn't get a chance to...

speaker: PATTERSON
line: He says he draws them to keep this demon of his away.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, that would make sense. Historically, that's what gargoyles have been used for. To ward off evil spirits. Like on the eaves of buildings.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: Come on, Mulder. I don't need a history lesson. And I don't need anyone indulging this guy's story.

speaker: MULDER
line: I was asked to look into this case. If you've got a problem with that I suggest you take it up with AD Skinner.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're not going to tell me when your love affair with Patterson ended?

speaker: MULDER
line: Patterson never liked me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I thought you were considered his fair-haired boy when you joined the bureau.

speaker: MULDER
line: Not by Patterson.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why not?

speaker: MULDER
line: Didn't want to get my knees dirty.

speaker: MULDER
line: Couldn't quite cast myself in the role of the dutiful student.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You mean you couldn't worship him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Something like that. Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, from what I hear, there are a lot of men who did. A lot of men joined the FBI because they wanted to be him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, Patterson had this thing about wanting to track a killer, to know an artist, you have to look at his art. It really meant, if you want to catch a monster, you have to become one yourself.

speaker: SCULLY
line: By the looks of this, I'd say that served him pretty well.

speaker: MULDER
line: This guy is definitely some kind of monster.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's just a cat...

speaker: SCULLY
line: I thought it was one of those pictures coming to life.

speaker: SCULLY
line: One of our guys must have locked it in here.

speaker: MULDER
line: No. He obviously has his own key to the place.

speaker: MULDER
line: There's air coming through here. There could be something on the other side of the wall.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's a door.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why don't you wait until we can get some more light in here?

speaker: MULDER
line: I've got some light.

speaker: SCULLY
line: See anything?

speaker: MULDER
line: More gargoyles, Scully. Lots of them. Sculpted in clay.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why would he keep them in a secret room?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, what is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you see?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder! Can you tell me what's going on in there?

speaker: DOCTOR
line: I'm not too encouraged by what I've seen. The man is lucky to be alive.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: Thank you, doctor. Agent Scully...

speaker: SCULLY
line: We've turned the studio upside down and there doesn't seem to be any more bodies.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: How many were recovered?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Five. All of them dismembered, all of them young men whose faces were mutilated. Just like the latest victim here.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: At least this one is still alive.

speaker: NEMHAUSER
line: Same signature mutilation right down to the choice of weapon by the look of it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What does Patterson have to say?

speaker: NEMHAUSER
line: I haven't spoken to him yet. But I bet he's going to come around to the idea that it's someone working directly with Mostow.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I'd have to agree with that theory.

speaker: NEMHAUSER
line: What's Agent Mulder think?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He thinks our finding Mostow's secret gallery isn't going to do him any favors with Patterson.

speaker: NEMHAUSER
line: Well, between you and me, I think Patterson secretly went to Skinner and requested Mulder on this case.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He requested him?

speaker: NEMHAUSER
line: I've worked with Patterson for three years on this. And this just about killed him, until we finally got a break and arrested Mostow. Then this first copy cat murder... It threw him for a loss.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder's under the impression that Patterson never thought too highly of hm.

speaker: NEMHAUSER
line: No. That's just Patterson. Late at night, with a few beers in him, he starts telling me Mulder stories. He's some kind of crack genius.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Stitches? What happened?

speaker: NEMHAUSER
line: Mostow. He bit me during the arrest.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: How's our victim? Has he been able to ID his attacker?

speaker: NEMHAUSER
line: Doctor says it's still too early to try.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: I'm not even sure he's going to make it.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: Where's Mulder?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He was going to see what he could find out about these drawings of Mostow's.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: What's he looking for?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think the same thing you are, sir. A second killer.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: I think you should continue this conversation outside.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Stay with us.

speaker: MULDER
line: The name is from the French "gargouille". The name of a medieval dragon that prowled the river Seine. Whose horrible image became the symbol of the soul of the condemned. Turned to stone. Or of the devils and demons of the underworld spared eternal damnation. The embodiment of the lesser forces of the universe who inspired dread, the threat of our own damnation. Ushers into hell or into the realm of our own dark fears and imagination. For over 1200 years, this grotesque image has found its expression in stone, clay, wood, oil and charcoal. Born again and again as if resurrecting itself by its own will through tortured human expression, almost as if it existed. Haunting men inwardly so that it may haunt mankind for eternity. As it must have haunted John Mostow. But what impulses moved it to kill? Could this be the same dark force at work? Its ultimate expression the destruction of the flesh? Of the very hand that creates it? Is this evil something born in each of us? Crouching in the shadow of every human soul waiting to emerge? A monster waiting to violate our bodies and twist our will to do its bidding? Is this the monster called madness?

speaker: PATTERSON
line: They're closing up in a few minutes.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: So... is this how you're looking for the second killer? Really, Mulder. What do you expect to find here?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm not sure yet.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: But you must have some idea. Some kind of theory.

speaker: MULDER
line: I have a few theories. I'm just trying to stitch them together right now.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: With your face stuck in a library book.

speaker: MULDER
line: You said it yourself. If you want to know the artist, look at the art. I'm finally agreeing with you.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: I know where you're going with this, Mulder. Because I've been there myself. So I can tell you you're wasting your time.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe you can also tell me why this man was compelled to sculpt and draw the same face again and again. Why he's still doing it now.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: Because he's insane.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: This is the scrawling of a mad man.

speaker: MULDER
line: He said that this thing wants to see his own reflection.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: Mostow has said everything but what I need to hear. The name of his accomplice.

speaker: MULDER
line: Unless he's telling the truth.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: About being possessed? I have to tell you, I'm really disappointed in you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, I wouldn't want to disappoint you by not disappointing you.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: After all this time I thought you finally put your feet back on the ground. Clearly, I was mistaken.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder? Mulder, its me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: MOSTOW'S SECRET GALLERY 3
line: 40 AM

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was scared, Mulder. I didn't know where you were. I kept trying your cell phone but you didn't answer.

speaker: MULDER
line: It was turned off.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You turned your phone off? Why do you even bother carrying it?

speaker: EMT
line: We're all set. You ought to see a doctor some time, in case of infection.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thanks.

speaker: EMT
line: Sure.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You still haven't told what you were doing in Mostow's studio.

speaker: MULDER
line: I was working.

speaker: SCULLY
line: AT 3:30 in the morning? Mulder, I haven't seen or spoken to you in almost two days. You haven't been returning my calls--

speaker: MULDER
line: This thing exists, Scully. It's real.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It? What are you talking about?

speaker: MULDER
line: Whatever keeps killing those young men.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mostow killed those men, Mulder, and out of some sick alliance some other person is continuing where he left off.

speaker: MULDER
line: Whoever attacked me wasn't a person.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, did you actually see it? Mulder, maybe you're seeing what you want to see.

speaker: MULDER
line: What makes you think I'd want to see that? I didn't imagine it, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Listen to yourself, Mulder. Listen to what you're saying. You're starting to sound like...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, when I couldn't reach you, I went to your apartment.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I saw your new wallpaper. Don't you realize what is happening here, Mulder? He is testing you. He is the reason you were brought on this case in the first place.

speaker: MULDER
line: Patterson?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He requested your involvement through Skinner's office. I checked the 302 myself.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder... where are you going?

speaker: PATTERSON
line: So, how's Mulder holding up?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, can I have a minute?

speaker: PATTERSON
line: Of course.

speaker: SCULLY
line: In private?

speaker: PATTERSON
line: What's this about?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe you can tell me... I'm curious about what you're doing concerning Agent Mulder.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: I'm afraid I don't know what you're talking about.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think you do, sir. I think you knew exactly how Agent Mulder would respond when you brought him on this case. You did request him, didn't you?

speaker: PATTERSON
line: If you're concerned about Agent Mulder's conduct or behavior, maybe you should take that up with him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know I already have.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: Then what do you expect me to do?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I just want you to be honest with me about what you're trying to do. Is this some kind of a payback for what happened eight years ago? Because Mulder quit the ISU?

speaker: PATTERSON
line: My motivations aren't that petty.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then why?

speaker: PATTERSON
line: I asked for Mulder because... I want to close the book on this God-forsaken case once and for all.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And you knew that he could help you solve it.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: My advice to you, Scully... Let Mulder do what he needs on this case. Don't get in his way and don't try to hold him back, because you won't be able to.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why didn't it kill me like it killed the others? Why did it let me live?

speaker: MOSTOW
line: I could never tell you why. You would not understand.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then help me understand, John.

speaker: MOSTOW
line: Please! Go away.

speaker: MULDER
line: No.... You have to help me go deeper. You have to help me get inside his head. Just how he got inside yours so I can find out what it wants.

speaker: MOSTOW
line: It knows what it wants.

speaker: MULDER
line: It wants to kill innocent young men by carving up their faces?

speaker: MOSTOW
line: You have felt its hunger... like your bones rattles by its frozen breath... So you know... nothing can be done.

speaker: MULDER
line: Unless I find it...

speaker: MOSTOW
line: Then what will you do?

speaker: MULDER
line: Just tell me how to find it, John.

speaker: MOSTOW
line: No!

speaker: MULDER
line: Just tell me how to find this thing.

speaker: MOSTOW
line: You can't find it.

speaker: MOSTOW
line: Only... It can find you...

speaker: MOSTOW
line: Maybe... it already has.

speaker: TECHNICIAN
line: First time I struck out. All three pieces were clean. On my second try, I got lucky. I dusted it with redwop.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry?

speaker: TECHNICIAN
line: Powder spelled backwards. It's what we call the flourescent light compodium.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It looks like a partial index.

speaker: TECHNICIAN
line: On the left half of the handle, almost a full thumb. The placement of the prints struck me...

speaker: SCULLY
line: They're oriented how someone would have gripped the knife.

speaker: TECHNICIAN
line: Which is why I thought I had the guy. Except I wasn't as lucky as I thought. So I ran the prints against the NCIC data base.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Your message said that you identified them.

speaker: TECHNICIAN
line: We did. Turns out it's one of our own people.

speaker: SCULLY
line: An FBI agent?

speaker: TECHNICIAN
line: Your partner.

speaker: SCULLY
line: These are Mulder's prints?

speaker: TECHNICIAN
line: Yes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you sure?

speaker: TECHNICIAN
line: I double checked. Why? I assumed he was the one who recovered the knife at the crime scene.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Excuse me.

speaker: GUY
line: There's a table up front.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, that's okay. You can just throw it on the floor.

speaker: GUY
line: I need to get that.

speaker: GUY
line: Evidence....

speaker: GUY
line: Yes, she is.

speaker: GUY
line: Agent Scully? Assistant Director Skinner has asked to see you right away.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Come in.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You wanted to see me, sir?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yes. Sit down.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I heard they found you in evidence. I assume you were looking for the murder weapon in this Mostow case?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Did you find it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Is it your opinion that missing evidence is the same weapon you recovered at a crime scene today?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm not altogether certain.

speaker: SKINNER
line: But Agent Mulder's prints were found on it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Have you seen Agent Mulder or spoken to him about this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Do you have any insight into Agent Mulder's current disposition of his mental state?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know Agent Mulder is working very hard on this case at your request, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Are you worried about him, Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No... sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Off the record.

speaker: SKINNER
line: So am I.

speaker: NEMHAUSER
line: Yeah... this is Craig Nemhauser... Please call me right away at 555-0143. I need to talk to you right away about a possible...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where are you?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm at Mostow's studio.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you with Nemhauser?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. Should I be?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, that's who I was calling. He left this number on my answering machine. He said he had to talk to me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder? Do you know where he is?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm not sure.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, that knife that we recovered at the crime scene, I think it's the same one that Mostow used.

speaker: MULDER
line: What makes you say that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Because Mostow's was stolen from evidence.

speaker: MULDER
line: When?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was hoping you could tell me. Your prints were all over it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. I examined Mostow's knife yesterday in the evidence room.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why?

speaker: MULDER
line: Because I wanted to hold it. Wanted to see what it felt like in my hand.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, but why?

speaker: MULDER
line: Look... Scully, I didn't take it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay, Mulder. Listen to me carefully. I want you to stay exactly where you are. I'm going to be there in a few minutes and we're going to work this thing out together. Okay? Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: Mulder...

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you doing here?

speaker: PATTERSON
line: What are you doing here?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's Nemhauser.

speaker: MULDER
line: But you already knew that, didn't you? You killed him, Bill. When he suspected it was you... You killed him.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: Are you out of your mind?

speaker: MULDER
line: Not me. Not now.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: Put that gun down.

speaker: MULDER
line: Not until you tell me what you're doing here.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: What I'm doing here!

speaker: MULDER
line: Look at your hands.

speaker: MULDER
line: Now ask yourself what you're doing here.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: I'm not sure.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're here because John Mostow stole three years of your life. Every day and every night for three years you lived and breathed the horror show that was in his head and I'm sorry... imagining everything that he imagined. Sinking deeper and deeper into the ugliness that you taught us to do. When you finally caught him, it didn't just go away, and the violence... it stayed alive inside you... til it had to come out. You didn't want to do what you were doing. You wanted to stop but you couldn't. Not by yourself. That's why you called on me in the first place, why you couldn't kill me when you had the chance.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder! What the hell are you doing?

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, get that light off me!

speaker: SCULLY
line: First, put the gun down.

speaker: MULDER
line: You don't understand!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Help me understand why you have a gun on Agent Patterson!

speaker: MULDER
line: It's him, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder!

speaker: SCULLY
line: You okay, Mulder?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We should call an ambulance. His pulse is still strong.

speaker: MULDER
line: This is Agent Mulder FBI. There's a man down... gunshot wound.

speaker: PATTERSON
line: Oh, God!

speaker: PATTERSON
line: Are you listening to me? For God's sakes! Is someone listening to me?! I didn't do it! It wasn't me! I didn't kill them! Please!!

speaker: MULDER
line: We work in the dark. We do what we can to battle the evil that would otherwise destroy us.

speaker: MULDER
line: But if a man's character is his fate, it's not a choice but a calling. Sometimes the weight of this burden causes us to falter. From the fragile fortress of our mind. Allowing the monster without to turn within. We are left alone staring into the abyss. Into the laughing face of madness.
